title: Claude Code Tools Comprehensive Guide
summary: Complete reference guide for Claude Code's WebSearch, WebFetch, and all built-in tools, plus custom tool creation methods including MCP, hooks, and API extensions
key_points: WebSearch provides snippets with citations, WebFetch retrieves full page content
14 built-in tools covering file operations, web access, shell commands, and task management
Custom tools can be created via bash scripts, slash commands, MCP, hooks, or API definitions
Some tools require explicit permissions for file modification or shell execution
Claude Code is extensible to integrate with external APIs and custom workflows
hooks: Claude Code has 14 built-in tools - here's the complete list
WebSearch vs WebFetch: Which tool should you use and when?
5 ways to extend Claude Code with your own custom tools
quotable_moments: WebSearch is for quick, up-to-date snippets with citations. WebFetch is for retrieving and analyzing the full content of a specific web page
Claude Code is designed to be extensible, enabling you to add your own tools and automate workflows beyond the built-in set
Place custom command scripts in a .claude/commands directory in your project. Each script becomes a slash command
review_notes: Excellent technical documentation with clear tables, practical examples, and comprehensive coverage of Claude Code's capabilities and extensibility options.
